detaileddescription.para: Do not call AddLocal() for our special addresses, e.g., for incoming Tor connections, to prevent gossiping them over the network.
Used to pass flags to the Bind() function
Maximum number of block-relay-only anchor connections
Anchor IP address database file name
Number of DNS seeds to query when the number of connections is low.
Minimum number of outbound connections under which we will keep fetching our address seeds.
How long to delay before querying DNS seeds

If we have more than THRESHOLD entries in addrman, then it's likely that we got those addresses from having previously connected to the P2P network, and that we'll be able to successfully reconnect to the P2P network via contacting one of them. So if that's the case, spend a little longer trying to connect to known peers before querying the DNS seeds.
Frequency to attempt extra connections to reachable networks we're not connected to yet
Subversion as sent to the P2P network in version messages

memberdef.type: std::function< void(const CAddress &addr, const std::string &msg_type, std::span< const unsigned char > data, bool is_incoming)>
memberdef.definition: std::function<void(const CAddress& addr, const std::string& msg_type, std::span<const unsigned char> data, bool is_incoming)> CaptureMessage
memberdef.name: CaptureMessage

detaileddescription.para: Defaults to CaptureMessageToFile(), but can be overridden by unit tests.

briefdescription.para: Convert the serialized seeds into usable address objects.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a local address that we should advertise to this peer.
check whether a given address is potentially local
Get the bind address for a socket as CService.
Look up IP addresses from all interfaces on the machine and add them to the list of local addresses to self-advertise. The loopback interface is skipped.
